title: Why Wine Lovers Resist Marie Kondo-ing Their Cellars
text: SOME YEARS AGO, a wine collector friend in New Jersey received a call from his babysitter. She confessed that she’d taken a bottle of wine from his cellar while he was out of town. The bottle turned out to be a 1982 Château Ducru-Beaucaillou, a second-growth Bordeaux worth about $500 today. If the babysitter hadn’t confessed to the theft, my friend said, he wouldn’t have noticed the bottle was missing. He has no formal means of tracking the 1,000 or so wines in his cellar.Many oenophiles I know—myself included—don’t have a system to keep track of the wines in our cellars. We buy bottles and put them away. I’ve definitely...
description: Maintaining an organized inventory is the best way to assess your collection’s value. Yet some oenophiles find joy—and the occasional buried treasure—in more eccentric arrangements.
